item.title: South Korea's KB Kookmin Bank Applies for Trademarks Related to USD and JPY StablecoinsAccording to the Korea Economic Daily, KB Kookmin Bank recently applied for 27 trademarks related to USD and JPY stablecoins, including "KBUSD" and "JPYKB," for a total of 49 trademark rights, covering categories such as stablecoin electronic financial platform software. Previously, KB Kookmin Bank applied for trademarks related to KRW stablecoins last month, and its current layout has expanded to the USD and JPY fields, intending to seize the trademark rights for foreign currency stablecoins. [Wu Blockchain]

item.title: Manta: RPC endpoint communication issue resolved, user funds not affectedModular L2 Manta Network tweeted that Manta Atlantic experienced a brief issue communicating with RPC endpoints, which has now been resolved. Network activity was not interrupted, and user wallets or funds were not affected. [Foresight News]

item.title: WOO X: Vulnerability stemmed from a team member's device being targeted by a phishing attack, allowing the attacker to access the development environmentWOO X tweeted that the vulnerability in the attack stemmed from a phishing attack that compromised a team member's device, allowing the attacker to access the development environment. Although the team took several security measures to limit access, the attacker still had time to make a series of withdrawals. The team is currently conducting a full review and prioritizing reopening withdrawal functionality for all users. The team will update on progress once the review is complete. [Foresight News]

item.title: Hotcoin Exchange is about to launch LMEOW, ASP, and LN spot trading and SLP contract trading.On July 25, according to official news, Hotcoin will launch the following trading pairs on July 25: Spot trading pairs LMEOW/USDT (July 25 12:00 UTC+8): $LMEOW is the native token of the LMEOW project. ASP/USDT (July 25 12:00 UTC+8): $ASP is the native token of the Aspecta project. Aspecta fills a fundamental gap in capital markets: early-stage or locked assets often enter the public market without transparent pricing, creating volatility and distrust. LN/USDT (July 25 18:20 UTC+8): $LN is the native token of the LNFI Network project. Lnfi Network unlocks multi-asset DeFi on the Lightning Network through next-generation financial infrastructure, enabling users to trade, earn, and manage Bitcoin, Taproot assets, and RGB assets through LightningFi. Contract trading pairs SLP/USDT (July 25 12:00 UTC+8): $SLP is a contract transaction for the Smooth Love Potion project, with a maximum leverage of 25x. Play the Axie Infinity game to earn Smooth Love Potion (SLP) tokens. [Techflow]

item.title: Binance Completes Horizen (ZEN) Contract SwapAccording to the official announcement, Binance has now completed the Horizen (ZEN) contract swap and opened the deposit and withdrawal services for the new ZEN (Base) token. The tokens have been swapped at a ratio of 1 old ZEN = 1 new ZEN. Deposits and withdrawals of ZEN tokens on the Horizen (ZEN) network will no longer be supported. [ChainCatcher]

item.title: Caixin: Qian Fenglei's Wealth Management Products Closed and RefundedQian Fenglei and Fofund, a wealth management product platform under several companies under his actual control, including Hengfeng International, issued a service change notice to investors on July 23, 2025. Fofund, as the fund manager, announced the closure and refund of the fund wealth management products "Duo Duo No. 1" and "Duo Duo No. 2". Reports against Qian Fenglei and Hengfeng International have been accepted by the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission and the Market Surveillance Division of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. [Caixin Report]

item.title: SlowMist Chief Information Security Officer: Speculation that WOO X may have an unauthorized access vulnerability due to API permission control issuesSlowMist Chief Information Security Officer 23pds tweeted that WOO X underwent an API v3 upgrade on June 30th, and he speculates that the vulnerability was caused by an authorization issue due to API permission control problems. The reasons are as follows: multiple withdrawals were made, and 9 malicious users can be clearly identified. "So it is highly likely that the vulnerability was caused by a mix of old and new APIs, permission control, or logical issues, which was then maliciously exploited." [Foresight News]

item.title: South Korean Police Arrest 60-Year-Old Suspect in ₩84.00B Ponzi Scheme While on ProbationAccording to Yonhap News Agency, the Anti-Corruption and Economic Crime Investigation Unit of the Gyeonggi Southern Provincial Police Agency in South Korea announced on the 25th that they have arrested a 60-year-old suspect, Mr. A, on suspicion of running an 84.00 billion KRW Ponzi scheme during his probation period, and transferred six accomplices to the prosecution. From October 2020 to January 2022, Mr. A and others held project presentations on AI, cryptocurrencies, and other topics in Gangnam-gu, Seoul, and attracted more than 2,200 investors with the promise of "300% returns on investment," defrauding them of 84.00 billion KRW. They used funds from new investors to pay "dividends" to early investors, perpetrating the scheme. This individual was previously sentenced to eight months in prison with a two-year suspended sentence for fraud in July 2021. Police remind the public to be especially vigilant about investment projects claiming high returns, especially those involving AI or cryptocurrencies, to avoid falling into Ponzi schemes. [ChainCatcher]

item.title: $4B Into Stablecoins, Crypto Real Estate, Korea BTC ETF Halted and MoreWelcome to the Asia Pacific Morning Brief—your essential digest of overnight crypto developments shaping regional markets and global sentiment. Grab a green tea and watch this space: GENIUS Act drives $4 billion stablecoin inflows. Christie’s launches crypto real estate division while Korean asset managers retreat from Bitcoin ETF plans amid regulatory concerns. Meanwhile, Injective tokenizes equity stakes, signaling institutional blockchain adoption acceleration. $4 Billion Flows Into Stablecoins Following GENIUS Act Passage Stablecoin markets captured $4 billion in capital inflows within one week of the GENIUS Act’s final passage, according to DeFiLlama data. Total stablecoin market capitalization surpassed $264 billion, representing 26.9% growth since January. Corporate stablecoin interest accelerated post-legislation. Anchorage Digital partnered with Ethena Labs, launching USDtb under federal compliance standards. WisdomTree introduced the USDW stablecoin targeting institutional adoption. Major banking institutions signal strategic entry plans. Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan confirmed dollar-pegged stablecoin development following regulatory clarity. JPMorgan and Citigroup initiated preliminary stablecoin preparation frameworks this month. Christie’s International Real Estate Launches Dedicated Crypto Division Christie’s International Real Estate has established the first major brokerage crypto division, according to The New York Times . The luxury firm created specialized teams of lawyers, analysts, and crypto experts. CEO Aaron Kirman launched the division after closing several high-value cryptocurrency transactions. The move follows a $65 million Beverly Hills property sale using digital currency. Kirman’s portfolio now includes over $1 billion worth of crypto-accepting properties. Notable listings include La Fin mansion at $118 million and Invisible House at $17.95 million. Recent regulatory developments support crypto real estate adoption. President Trump signed the GENIUS Act, establishing stablecoin federal rules. The House passed the Clarity Act, providing industry regulatory protection. Cryptocurrency offers enhanced buyer anonymity compared to traditional LLC structures. Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac now consider crypto investments in mortgage applications. Kirman projects cryptocurrency will comprise one-third of residential transactions within five years. Korean Asset Managers Withdraw Bitcoin ETF Plans Amid Regulatory Pushback Major South Korean asset management firms abandoned Bitcoin investment fund plans through regulatory sandboxes, according to a local media report . Samsung Asset Management, Mirae Asset Global Investments, and KB Asset Management explored Bitcoin-focused allocation funds using innovation finance exemptions. The firms sought temporary regulatory relief to include virtual assets as underlying investments. Current capital market laws prohibit cryptocurrency as a fund base asset. Financial authorities provided negative feedback during preliminary consultations, prompting voluntary withdrawals. Industry sources suggest the attempt aimed at establishing precedent for future crypto ETF introductions. All three firms confirmed no formal applications were submitted. The pushback reflects concerns about policy disruption amid pending Digital Asset Innovation Act legislation. Authorities emphasized maintaining procedural integrity while a comprehensive crypto framework development proceeds. This strategic retreat highlights institutional caution in navigating evolving regulatory landscapes. Officials expect systematic virtual asset product launches following legislative completion , potentially by the second quarter of 2025, signaling Korea’s measured approach to crypto market integration. Injective Protocol Tokenizes SharkLink Gaming Equity Stakes Layer-1 blockchain Injective launched its Digital Asset Treasury (DAT) platform, tokenizing shares of Ethereum investment firm SharkLink Gaming as its inaugural offering. The tokenized equity trades under the symbol ‘$SBET’ on Injective’s on-chain infrastructure with real-time capabilities. SharkLink Gaming ranks as the world’s second-largest corporate Ethereum holder according to Strategic Ethereum Reserve data. The tokenization represents Injective’s strategy to bridge traditional financial markets with decentralized ecosystems. Unlike conventional asset wrapping mechanisms, DAT-based tokenization incorporates governance rights and multi-chain liquidity integration alongside trading functionality. The platform enables 24-hour continuous trading, establishing new liquidity standards for equity-backed digital assets. This development signals expanding institutional adoption of blockchain-native financial instruments, demonstrating practical applications for traditional asset digitization within DeFi frameworks. Shigeki Mori contributed. [DeFiLlama; The New York Times; a local media report]
